Reviews.Title: “Where else will they happily accept four large dogs?”
Reviews.Author: Kassy M
Reviews.Content: Five paws up from all the doggies! We went to this hotel in January to take our four dogs to the beach. When we called to make a reservation, the lady on the phone was very pleasant. When we arrived, she was even nicer and very accommodating to both us and the dogs. She said we could give notice at any time if we wanted to stay another day and let us check in very, very early. (We did stay another day) It must be said that I rated five stars for the DOGS. Where else can you go that they happily accept four large dogs? This place was perfect: tile floors, the rooms have a community back yard with screen and glass doors to the patio, literally on Dog Beach, the rooms are simple so there's no worrying about the dogs ruining something in all their frenzy, and the dog wash station they provide is awesome! Shampoo, towels, hoses. Don't come here expecting anything fancy. Bare simple basic for the humans- it really seems like a dog hotel first. But when you get to go to the beach with all your dogs instead of leaving them with a babysitter, it's totally worth the cheesy bedding and squeaky mattress. (Besides, who'd want to put nice bedding out if you know dogs were gonna be all over it?) The dogs had a fantastic time and we have already made another reservation for March. I'll go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take your dog!”
Reviews.Author: pepper123456
Reviews.Content: We took our dog here for the Christmas Holiday. It is a 1-2 minute walk from Dog Beach. You cannot beat this location. The dog rooms are tiled and have a shared, fenced patio. The room we were in had an average sized bedroom, large patio doors leading outside & a dressing area somewhat separate from the bedroom. Worked perfectly for us as I like to sleep in a bit & my better half likes to get up in the morning & make coffee. It was the best of both worlds. The staff was extremely helpful & friendly. They truly would bend over backwards to meet your needs. They even had a restaurant guide that listed pet friendly patios. The only negative was the comfort of the bed. It is a beautyrest mattress & appeared newer, but was a bit uncomfortable. Next year when we come back we will bring our portable mattress pad. They even had a dog wash station! We gave them a 4 (only because of the mattress), but our pooch would have easily given them a 5!

Reviews.Title: “If you love your dogs....”
Reviews.Author: cre8Pinot
Reviews.Content: Ocean Villa has a great staff that is friendly and helpful. The motel is walking distance from the dog beach. The dog rooms are titled and have a shared back yard that the dogs run around in (all visitors don't pick up the s**t. There are some minor setbacks that make it hard to pay the asking price for the room. 1. There is a NON-refundable fee that is added on top of your hotel bill ($30)-Yes, they tell you. 2. The offered dog towels do not look or feel any different from the human bath towels. 3. The place is completely dark at night? 4. The beds are uncomfortable and past their prime. The hotel could use some updating on the lower level. Making the decor simple and spacious would help. Ocean Villa really needs to get some new towels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: storm180
Reviews.Content: This was a great motel on the beach. Very comfortable rooms and they allow dogs. The dog rooms are on the lower level and open to a fenced dog run. The upper rooms have balconys that over look the beach area and it has a table and chairs. The motel has a very friendly staff and they there is a pool and they serve continental breakfast every morning. We were looking for a reasonable priced motel with beach access and this fit the bill. The beach area is split between a people beach and a dog beach so its a motel for everyone. Motel has direct access to the boardwalk. WIFI signal was strong and very fast. There are several places to eat nearby within walking distance and alot are dog friendly. I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel i have ever been in”
Reviews.Author: ron m
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel that i have ever stayied at. the bent over backwards to make everyone happy. they up graded our room for no extra cost so we had beds for all for of us. the power went out in the whole state of cal. they made sure every room had candles. there was no stores or restraunts open due to no power so they got a bunch of food and put it out for all the guests to eat for free. they got us ice for our coolers. they love pets and kids. the rooms were very clean and fresh. the have a fenced in dog run and a place for you to wash your dogs with tubs and shampoo even towles to dry them. to top it all off they gave us that night free of charge because there was no power. the pool was clean and nice. this hotel is on the beach and very nice. i had such a great time we stayied another night. they even had treats for uor dogs. they are wounerful people there. i will stay there every time we go to san diego, ca.

Reviews.Title: “Bring the dogs!”
Reviews.Author: sdtaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with my teenage daughter and our 2 dogs. Location can't be beat for those that want to bring the dogs and spend some time at Dog Beach! Sure the rooms are a bit dated, but certainly comfortable enough. We paid a bit more for the 'family room' that is larger and included a futon, which the dogs quickly made theirs. Loved the full sized fridge! The fenced in dog run is nice and the dogs liked being able to socialize. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: joni_312
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled great. It was surprisingly clean for a pets allowed room. The floors were all tile. We were not worried about our dog laying on the bed or being a nuisance as everyone had dogs. It was fenced in. There was a grassy run along the patio. There was a lot of doggy socializing. Many of the guest were frequent patrons. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't have to drive our car the few days we were there, as everything was in walking distance. The doggy beach was Nirvana for our Bucket List Dog. We will definitely be back. Maggie, Sedona , AZ.

Reviews.Title: “In DIre Need of Work”
Reviews.Author: Ztravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my two goldens. Good location, next to Dog Beach, but the room was terrible. Beat up furniture, stains on sheets, old tv, dirty tile floor, generally dilapidated. We paid for two days left after the first. .

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: mikayla73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went on a girls weekend to San Diego and we brought her dog. San Deigo was awesome and I'm looking forward to going back for another visit. This place is actually in Ocean Beach, which we loved! It is very close to the beach as others have mentioned, literally a 2 min walk and you are there. The dog beach was nice and it was great to see all the dogs playing. The motel was OK. We stayed for two nights. I had read some of the reviews on here and it is a good place to go with your dog. They are set up very well for them, the floors are tile, they have a dog wash so you can want the sand off, and the dog run by the rooms is nice. The swimming pool at the hotel looked fine (we didn't use it - there's an ocean to play in!). We didn't have any issues with getting breakfast after 9a, there was still plenty and they were restocking. It is your basic cont breakfast: yogurt, breads, oatmeal, cold cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, and coffee. The staff seemed friendly and they were prompt in cleaning our room. We had to let them know when we would be out with the dog and they cleaned it then. They do have wifi. The room itself was basic: two beds, tv w/ cable, micro, and refrig. The bathroom was huge. The toilet and shower were in their own room with a door which made it easier to get ready for the day. My main issue was with the beds. The mattresses were litteraly 3 inches thick. There were springs poking through every inch of them. Since the mattress was so thin, it meant you're basically sleeping on the box springs with matress springs poking you. I woke up with my hips and shoulders hurting from laying on my side. I was thankful it was only two nights on those beds. I'm not sure I would last a whole week there. The shower was just a shower, no tub (which is fine by me, I'd never take a bath in a motel anyway). The shower enclosure was older and it showed. We did encounter a rather large bug. There was space under the door, so it could have came in there, but it was in the shower. I was not a happy camper. My friend got rid of it and thankfully we only saw the one. I realize that you are paying for location and the convenience of being able to take your dog with you at this motel, but $178 is pretty steep for it and that doesn't include the nightly pet fee. I'd never stay here without a dog. There are much better hotels, close to the beach, for about the same $ that are way nicer if you don't have a dog. There are other hotels that accept dogs that are nicer, but are not nearly as close to dog beach as this one. I'd be ify on staying here again. It would have to be for no more than two nights. I couldn't sleep on those beds, for that price, for any longer. I would certainly do some more research to see what other places were close that accepted dogs before just booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for average family”
Reviews.Author: jwe77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to the beach, very close. It sits on a neighborhood street with beach houses and apartment complexes. It was very quiet during our stay. We walked to the beach at 11:30 at night and there were a few people at the the bonfire pits, couples walking the beach, and a few homeless sleeping on the benches. Saw a cop drive through the neighborhood and around the parking lot at dog beach. People said hello as they walked by. The hotel room was clean and comfortable enough for my average middle class family. We even broght our dog and there was a shared yard in back for him to do his thing. There is a dog wash, a laundry room, snack machine, free parking at the hotel and a free breakfast of yogurt, cereals, fruit, breads, juice, coffee. We had a good stay at ocean villa inn. If you are used to upscale accomidations this place is not for you but it is good for the average joe and his family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in a room on the dog run”
Reviews.Author: r2so1
Reviews.Content: Supposed to have dogs on leashes our dog was attacked by a saint bernard . Staff was nice ,bring your own towels .get to the breakfast 10 minutes after it opens or there maybe nothing left. You REALLY have to love dogs to stay in the dog run rooms....outside of that not too bad.Great location

Reviews.Title: “Dog House”
Reviews.Author: Lodestone123
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique property. If you don’t have a pet in tow, it is merely an overpriced, rundown beachside motel. If you brought pups along, it’s an awesome experience. We brought our two dogs and stayed in the downstairs, dog-friendly rooms. The Bad: ancient, creaky spring mattresses, ants (albeit harmless, tiny ones), noise from upstairs, no sign of maid services (we stayed two nights), limited nearby dining options (it is in an aging residential neighborhood), occasional homeless bum sighting. Absurdly dim room lighting. San Diego’s beaches are generally surprisingly cloudy and cold unless you visit during late summer or early fall. The Good: decent fare at the free continental breakfast. The closest dining option is excellent: the Surf Rider Pizza Café (http://www.surfriderpizzacafe.com/) served outstanding, huge veggie Stromboli. The TV set offered about 60 channels. Their free wi-fi was painless. The heater/AC unit drowns out all noise, enabling a decent night’s sleep. The Dog: Instant entertainment/chaos provided by opening your sliding-glass door, which puts you in the common, fenced-in dog run. Neighboring pups are free to visit, and will, whether you want them or not. For whatever reason, dogs almost always get along when no leashes are involved, and ours did fine. Very short walk to neighboring Dog Beach, which allows dogs to be unleashed and frolic in the surf. The water is shallow and the beach is bordered by a tidal basin. There were about twenty dogs there every time we visited, mostly retrievers frantically diving in after thrown balls. We love dogs and beaches, so for us, it was heaven on earth.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS! One of the worst places I have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: lg1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed lt week for ONE night. It was dirty, the springs were poking up thru the mattress, which wa sonly about 3 inches thick. In the morning my husband was outside in the dog run with our Mini Schaunzer, there was a black lab just running around even tho the rules clearly state you are supposed to supervise your dog. When my husband opened the door to come back in this dog came right in our room and jumped up on top of me. I reported to the front desk and they said they would try to find the owner. Then I went outside on the patio to have my coffee and this same dog jumped on me again and spilled my coffee on me. Plus it is right in the flight path for the airport and the noise was terrible. Would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your pups!”
Reviews.Author: amondala
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The people (and dogs!) at the front desk were warm, friendly, and welcoming. They really understood what it was like to travel with my four-legged furry kids and I really appreciate that a lot when it comes to my "kids." The room was good, definitely not a fancy shmancy room, but it had all the necessities in clean, working order. You can't beat the location, right next to the beach, the dog beach in fact, and my girls were ever so happy to be staying right next to the beach. The dog run just outside the patio door was perfect for letting the girls out in the morning and at night and it was kinda funny to watch random dogs walking by our room too. The beds could be improved upon, but other than that, I wouldn't change a thing. This place is perfect, especially if you love your dogs!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and price but not if you are traveling without Fido”
Reviews.Author: JoJoStateWorker
Reviews.Content: Its one of those places where I think, damn if I owned this I would do this , this and this....I was on a business trip in El Cajon and knew I wanted to at least look at the beach while in San Diego. THis place is easy to find, easy to park at and easy to check in. HOWEVER you are out of luck if you want an elevator (I had 2 large suitcases I had to lug on my own). I had room 30 which is one of the nicer rooms I heard. It was just me so I didnt really care. THe door is in need of repair, looks like police or someone knocked it in (or down). THe shower was adequate but nothing special. There was a nice sized fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker which were all spotless (I think thats important). There were a few new touches in the room like a flat screen, an awesome electric fireplace and desk and chair. THe carpet was a little disturbingly stained but I swear, if they replaced that with tile or faux wood it would be very charming. The king sized bed was old and springy but I tended to over look that once I saw my private patio with table and chairs over looking the beach. The ceiling looked really worn and water damaged too. BUT I got service with a smile and a lovely view. I barely noticed it was a dog hotel, never heard barking but saw lots of happy dog owners on the first floor. I would stay here again but my expectations were too high when I booked it.

Reviews.Title: “filthy, rundown,overpriced, not fit even for dogs!”
Reviews.Author: thomt32724
Reviews.Content: Choose this motel because it was dog friendly, and close to where our son lives. Had a great dog beach next door, but you don't need to stay there to go to this beach. We originally booked the room for 3 days, arriving late in the day we stayed one night. Room was filthy. Urine on floor which I cleaned with a towel. Towel was brown and dirty after use. Shower didn't drain, with stuff coming up from drain. Bath fan didn't work. Ceiling light didn't have a lens cover. Towels like I had in PE in high school (2). Really disappointing. For over $100.00 per night plus taxes, etc and a pet fee, it is way over priced. Staff must know how bad it is because they didn't bat and eye when we asked for a refund for the two remaining nights. Left there and went to the Sheriton, La Jolla. It is also pet friendly, Not much farther away from our son, and for the same price. Go there if you want to have a first class room. Clean, Modern, up-to-date, with onsite restaurant, room service, great bed, WiFI and the list goes on and on. They even give you a little bag with pet bags in it for your pet!

Reviews.Title: “Good for us, great for our dogs”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Fun_4400
Reviews.Content: The lower level of the Ocean Villa is made for people who travel with dogs. Tile floors, sliding glass door to the dog run, outdoor patio, and less than a five minute walk to Dog Beach. Management takes reasonable precautions to make sure that things don't get out of hand (like jotting down my neighbor's cell phone number, so if their dogs went crazy, peace could be restored). I'm not sure why they took down my phone number, though. The management here is really down to earth. Dog beach is the best. For a casual night with the pooches, you can't beat it. But if you want the Ritz Carlton, go to the Ritz Carlton, and not the Ocean Villa.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: TucsonRoy
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay while in San Diego I recommend the Ocean Villa Inn. My main purpose for the trip was to spend time at Dog Beach with my canine and best friend Nikita. My hotel room was clean, comfortable and had a sliding glass door conveniently located out to a dog run. We enjoyed the Inn as much as the beach itself. The staff was outstanding from housekeeping to the front desk. The in-room fridge and microwave are a huge plus and the in-room coffee is always a must. They offer a continental breakfast that offered assorted yogurts, muffins, cereals and a waffle maker. The Inn was in walking distance to shopping and Restaurants but we mainly ordered in take out. I will be Back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat being right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: hummin4u
Reviews.Content: We travel once a year with our two dogs and this is their vacation. Granted the hotel is not a Marriott or Hyatt, but it's right on the beach. The dog beach is right around the corner and if you stay downstairs, your sliding glass door opens to (I call it) a dog run. No need to worry that your dog can run away. And if you go to the beach, there is a convenient water spout at the end of the building to clean your dog off. The hotel is old, and yes, there probably could be a few things they could do to make it more appealing. But the location is just unbelievable and the staff is very very friendly. The free breakfast is adequate. We usually never have a problem with other guests, in fact, the ones that bring their dogs as well are very nice. Have yet to meet someone who was not "dog friendly"!

Reviews.Title: “It was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: t100169
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent the labor day weekend at Ocean beach, CA. I was reluctant to reserve a room at Ocean Villa due to some recent bad review, however we ended staying the night at the hotel. Ocean villa inn is not a luxury hotel, it is like a best western, My family stayed in the bottom floor due to our dog. The lower floors is for families with dogs, it had a musty odor but the floors were clean, the sheets were clean, the bathroom worked great. We did not have any problems with other people's dog coming in to our room... The staff at Ocean villa inn were very friendly. Lydia was very helpful. The hotel location is very convenient to ocean beach and dog beach. We had an amazing time at the beaches. I would recommend Ocean villa inn...especially for families with pets..

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for pet-friendly travel"”
Reviews.Author: CrystalRose23
Reviews.Content: We have two "special needs" Doxies. We screen hotels very carefully for accomodations. TripAdvisor.com is my favorite site for hotel reviews; It can make or break our decision to stay at a particular location. Imagine my resistance to staying at Ocean Villa Inn this past weekend after reading all the negative "press". We have been to Ocean Beach several times this year. The only reason we took the chance and decided to book the room at Ocean Villa Inn is because we have seen it before from the outside, chatted with management, and met a pet owner who was very happy with her stay. It was more than we hoped for. The room was extremely clean and very spacious! The bed and pillows, although not like the comforts of home or a 5-star hotel, were completely adequate and we slept well. The "neighbors" were friendly and we had so much fun watching all the pups, big and small, in the dog run. This particular hotel, right next to Doggie Beach, is a good 15-20 minute walk from the center of town where all the restaurants are. We made several walks into town with our pups and absolutely loved the exercise. So did they! Yes, we heard the planes overhead on occasion, but it did not bother us. Overall, this hotel is in a very quiet location; that's one of the things I loved about it. For the price, friendliness, cleanliness and space, I give this hotel an A+. Thank you, Cassandra and Lydia, for making our stay an extremely pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great for dogs; not so much for people”
Reviews.Author: Finediner17
Reviews.Content: Price was for the location only--right off the beach. Beds were hard as the floor, extremely thin walls, poor sleep. The patios and shared grass area was great for the dogs and to chat with other owners. Make sure you keep the screen door closed to your room because after the dogs meet they will proceed to visit.(I thought it was great but if you have a territorial dog there could be issues.) Breakfast was cold and meager. Best to treat this place as a notch above camping and stock in lots of stuff with you. There was microwave and fridge but only an instant coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Dogs / Average for People”
Reviews.Author: Scasa79
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Ocean Villa with our two dogs for 3 days. They gave us a room on the first floor that had a patio area and a grassy area where you can let your dogs out to play. The dogs had a WONDERFUL time. The beach is a few yards away and it is a dog-friendly beach. It's huge so you can either go to the beach part or bay part. with the dogs. As for us humans, we had an okay time. Service was very nice, but the rooms need some major updating. However, house keeping came right away and made our room look and smell great. Oh, I should mentioned, the housekeepers are "afraid" of the dogs so just make sure to have Roover outside when she is cleaning the room. The hotel overall serves its purpose, it's just not that comfortable. We ate at the Fig Tree Cafe (google location). AWESOME!!! Great breakfast. Nice portions. You can't go wrong. For dinner, The Ventian. It's hard to find good italian food on the West Coast (we're from NY), but this place hit the spot. Try the Pinot Grigio from Argentina.....yum. HORRIBLE service from Fred's Mexican in old town. Food was average, but from the hostess not knowing where to seat us, to the bartender hissing at us that her station was closed, to the rude manager trying to tell us to go wait on line AFTER we have been seated - kinda ruined our experience. All around poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Woof woof for Dog Beach”
Reviews.Author: holymoly121
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Ocean Villa Inn with our 3 small dogs. Staff was really very friendly. We arrived 4 hours earlier than check-in, and they had us in our room withing one hour, thank you staff. Great spot for people wanting to travel with your animals. The rooms and accommodations are geared for the animal lover not a spa or special amenity type stay. We slept well but the airport is nearby, so if you ar a light sleeper, bring earplugs. The beds are not comfortable and I believe are old school...springs. The staff do not disturb the rooms with animals in them unless requested to do so, and this is just perfect. Morning breakfast is muffins, waffles ,juice etc and is fine to get you moving. Rooms are again, not 3, 4 or 5 star but provide for the basics, hot water, microwave, HBO, wifi, is secure etc.... Great value for a pet traveler or a budget traveler. No evidence of a soiled or smelly room, no critters crawling around and very quiet at night. Was able to see the nightly fireworks display at Sea World from our room. Was able to let the dogs roam the large beach, unharnessed ( right behind the hotel, yeah!!) and met a lot of other playful pooches and their owners. After their morning run, we were able to wander around La Jolla, tour Midway, go to Balboa Park, Seaport Village and take in the surf next to the Pier. As this location was in a great location, we could run our dogs along the park and the beach several times a day. They pretty much slept all the way back to Arizona, again, yeah. Rented bikes and ate at a few fun places as well along the way. Great little spot to forget about work. The community supports the animal traveler and as a whole are very friendly. There will always be "characters" in and around a beach type/casual setting, but none of them bothered us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Four paws up and a belly rub, this is the place for beach loving dogs!”
Reviews.Author: five4theroad
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that this is an older motel on Dog Beach...not the Holiday Inn, more along the lines of a Motel 6. If you love the beach and your dog, and aren't looking for a 5 star experience, this is the place for you. The bottom rooms are for dogs and their people. Tile floors (that never did feel really clean, so we wore our socks. And there is a broom/dust pan in your room), older furnishings/linens. All clean. A separate vanity area has a mini frig and microwave. The shower was old and we had plumbing issues (back up in the shower and sink). Staff was able to move us into another room when they found out the plumber wouldn't be in til the afternoon. One of the best features is the dog run which each lower room opens up to. There is a porch with a table, chairs and a bench. But keep the screen closed if you don't want dogs wandering into your room! And don't forget to clean up after your pooch! Dog Beach is a short walk from the motel, along a nice bike/walking path. The area around the motel is rather run down, this isn't Malibu! Smells like you'd expect a dog beach to smell like (wet dog with some (ahem) urine mixed in), and watch where you walk!! Dog clean up bags are provided at the motel and along the beach, please use them! If sunbathing and relaxing is what you're looking for in a beach, this isn't the spot for you. Dogs are free to be off leash and love it. Watching them play was enjoyable. There is another beach just over the walkway from Dog Beach, if you'd like to be with only people. There is a dog hosing off area at the end of the building (past room 29). Just a hose and they'll give you a towel. The pool was very nice, not really warm, but good enough and well taken care of. The grounds were nice with all the cactus and plants. The staff was wonderful - all of them (I forgot their names...Lydia? Cassandra?). Very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fine to start the day off, nothing fancy, but the waffles were good and the breakfast room was nice. Dogs were well behaved, occasional barks were heard at night, but what do you expect at a dog motel? Our upstairs neighbors were much more annoying than any dog we heard. I would recommend it to dog loving friends, not sure if a non dog person would like it so much.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT Recommend”
Reviews.Author: awright517
Reviews.Content: Pros - Located right on the beach, continental breakfast features make your own waffles, assorted cereals, toast, english muffins, assorted yogurt, assorted juices, coffee, tea, & hot chocolate. Computer in lobby for guest use. Close and with in walking distance to Ocean Beach boardwalk/attractions, restaurants, etc. Cons - The place is run down, in need of a MAJOR refurbishment and everything is very out dated!! This is by no means a hotel, it's a motel at best. The rooms are small, the beds feel like you're sleeping on springs (probably the worst nights sleep I've ever had), the linen had holes in some of them, i.e. holes in bedspread and blanket, the unit we were in only had a shower stall and no bathtub, the grout in the tile floors either need a massive cleaning or new grout because it's very dirty. The woodwork on the walls is knicked all through out, the ceiling fan in the room we were in only worked if the bathroom light was on which made me think there was some faulty electrical wiring in the place. We did have our dogs with us and the place allows dogs. Those traveling with dogs are put in the first level units and all the first level unit patio doors open to a large enclosed area in the back so everyone's dogs are out there together which is fine. The problem being is that if you don't close your door you will have other people's dogs wandering through your room, which happened to be the case with us. What's worst is that someone else's dog went #2 on one of our beds and another dog (or maybe it was the same one, who knows) lifted it's leg and peed on the other bed. That's when I said we were out of there. It was bad enough they were charging almost $200 a night (including tax and pet fee) when the place isn't even worth even what a Motel 6 charges a night!! We had booked for 5 nights and checked out after 1. There is an outdoor heated pool that looked like it was kept up, although we didn't use it. If you're looking for anything luxurious you won't find this here. Heck this isn't even up to par with Holiday Inn's or Ramada's ... even those places are better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bisonboyTucson
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Ocean Villa Inn for about five years now. Not only is it close to the beach, dining and shopping, the staff is FANTASTIC. We always reserve a 2nd floor room and the balcony in the evening with the view can't be beat and the continental breakfast is a nice feature. We have never had any complaints. We are looking forward to our stay at the end of July 2010.

Reviews.Title: “A REAl Pet Lovers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerry_Rita
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with a dog this is the hotel that is soooooooooooooo pet friendly. They not only allow pets in the room they have the back of the property fenced so that at night all you need to do is open the patio door and let your pet out to do his thing. If you are visiting Dog Beach you are just steps away from the beach and the hotel provides dog towels, a dog wash, dog treats, you get the picture. The hotel is conveniently located to many restaurants and shops that are dog friendly as well. To all those folks who whined about the hotel having sand on the floor, pet hair and a dampness/musty smell, I have this to say to you--You are not a real ocean lover, pet lover or beach lover-don't go to Dog Beach, go somewhere you don't have to go in the sand or near the ocean, better still stay at home and enjoy the ocean by picts on you computer. I would recommend this hotel over any that I have stayed in in San Diego because I love my dog and he is a real member of my family and travels with us. This hotel welcomes ALL members of your family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for dogs, but not for people”
Reviews.Author: K10AZ
Reviews.Content: Our dog loved staying here, I wish we could say the same for ourselves. The beds were terribly uncomfortable, and we kept waking up to other dogs barking and planes taking off. There were some really sketchy characters roaming around the parking lot, too. On a positive note - the staff was very friendly, and free wifi! Pay the extra $ don't stay in Ocean Beach, you'll be much happier elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great dog location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBoy
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip visiting from Orange County, CA. Although the hotel is not a 5 star hotel, the proximity to dog beach makes up the difference. If you don't have any dogs, the other side of the dog beach is also fantastic. Our party consisted of two adults and three dogs in a room with two either double or queen size beds. There's a mini frig, microwave, coffee maker and doggy bags inside the room. The tile floors worked well with all the sand brought in by our dogs. There's an open patio off the rooms downstairs and private balconies for the rooms upstairs. Off the patio there's a fenced area for the dogs to roam. There's a continental breakfast which includes cereal, toast, muffins, eggs, sausage, cinnamon toast, coffee and juices. The person at the front desk was extremely cheerful and had remembered me from my last visit two years prior. If you're into outdoor exercising, there are alot of people either walking, jogging, or biking on the path adjacent to the hotel. There's also a variety of eating places either near the hotel or at the main area of Ocean Beach. The front desk person recommended Chris' liquor store for sandwiches located approx. 5 blocks from the hotel. This place uses Boar's Head meats. The sandwiches were very delicious and the staff was very friendly. If you don't want to stay in a fancy hotel but want to be close to the Pacific Ocean, with or without dogs, this hotel could be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem for dogs and their owners”
Reviews.Author: dogtired16
Reviews.Content: Ocean Villa Inn is the best place I've found for staying close to the beach with my dog at a reasonable price. You just can't beat having an off-leash dog beach, a beach for people without dogs, and restaurants and shops within walking distance. The hotel staff is friendly and the rooms with patios and access to the grassy dog play area are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Inn”
Reviews.Author: Elviskingandi
Reviews.Content: I go there 4 times a year with my dogs. It is a wonderful place to stay and allow my dogs to run without a leash. The service is friendly, rooms are clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Funky OB”
Reviews.Author: michSF
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here last summer. I was just trying to book it again and no rooms are available, so decided I should at least let others know how much we'd liked our stay. We had 3 separate rooms - 2 connected on the upper floor and 1 below. The upper room patios were so comfortable to hang out on, watch the ocean sunsets and the fun on Dog Beach, and the 2 connected rooms had a nice couch/seating area that everyone was able to hang out in. The staff, while extremely busy, were also extremely friendly and handled any request asked of them. Ocean Beach is not necessarily what some would expect from San Diego and to us that was just great. The majority of the members of our party live in suburban San Diego and they really enjoyed the different atmosphere in their own city. my partner and I are from San Francisco, so Ocean Beach was surprisingly like home, just warmer, beachier - more like Santa Cruz than San Diego. Great authentic restaurant and shopping experiences abound in the 'hood. If you can't feel comfortable on a real urban beach with real people who are not all the same, better stay away from Ocean Beach in general, not just this hotel. We loved the mix of cultures and experiences in OB.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Dog Friendly hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: surfingdogs
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, our two dogs and I go every year to San Diego to escape the heat in Arizona.Our favorite place to stay is Ocean Villa Inn, their staff is very helpful to any needs, Great rooms and great location to beach.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was HORRIBLE !!”
Reviews.Author: rsmurrell
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was not worth $150.00 per night. The customer service was horrible. The parking was deplorable. We arrived a little early and asked to use the restroom while we wait for our room, and were told to walk half of a mile down the street to a public restroom at the beach!! There were four of us and we requested a room with two beds. They woman who booked the room failed to book the room we requested. When we discovered that we did not get the room we requested, the arrogant woman behind the front desk did nothing to help us but offer a "roll away" bed for two adults. That was after she argued with us about the room reservation. We called twice to confirm that we would get a room with two beds and were told that we would have our desired rooms. She would not accept responsibility for her mistake or even offer an apology. She offered plenty of attitude however. The hotel was dirty and the staff unhelpful. Had we had more time , we would have demanded our money be returned to us and searched for different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Decent”
Reviews.Author: Jess_Tim
Reviews.Content: I am not a dog lover and was very uncomfortable booking this place. We booked because we were meeting another family that was staying there. This was by no means a luxury resort, but it was not bad. We do not have a dog so we were upstairs in the "no doggie" zone. Our room was basic with 2 beds a patio with a table and chair a small shower, a mini fridge and micowave(in the bathroom) definitly nothing fancy. Our friends asked for a family room and had a mini kitchen with a sink full fridge 2 queen beds a futon and a large patio. I will definitly request this room for the extra $50 bucks just for the space when we go back. I did not see dog poop, and did not hear one dog bark during the night which were my two big concerns traveling with a 4 yr old. It was a quick walk to the beach which was great. There was also a hose on the side of the hotel to spray off your dog, but we stood to the side and used it on our feet and beach toys, it worked out great. The staff is very nice, and they also offered a free breakfast in the mornings with cereal, muffins, and some hot food. All in all a good place for a quick, cheap weekend trip with the kids to play at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaSweetpea
Reviews.Content: So many good things to say about this place! We did not have a dog with us. It was very quiet and we had an upstairs balcony that overlooked the beach. We chose the Ocean Villa Inn for the price and location, and our expectations were far exceeded. They're in the middle of upgrading the rooms. Our room was immaculate, comfortable, and spacious. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. An unexpected bonus was the owner's collection of extraordinary succulent specimens, which are interesting even if you're not a plant person. You can take the city bus here from the airport in about half an hour total. MY RESPONSE TO DISGRUNTLED REVIEWERS: OK, the pool wasn't heated but it was clean, and to be fair and clarify: Ocean Beach has "homeless people and hippies and low end yuppies" as well as people of color, if that's what you meant by "gang members". We felt safe, welcome and very happy to be there. This place is outstanding value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: RensRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: Maybe not for travelers who are too picky or demanding, but WE thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Ocean Villa Inn in early May! Suited us perfectly. Great location next door to Dog Beach. The Ocean Beach community is definitely funky and laid-back - also colorful, lively and friendly. Our rooms were spacious and clean; liked the patio, open view beyond, and screened sliding door for letting in surf sounds and sea breeze. Also the warm-water dog wash! The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially Kelly & Josh - even Skip, the plant caretaker. Breakfast is minimal; the guest above us one night was noisy; the shower plumbing in #14 could stand renovating (underway?) - but the sandy floor, which another reviewer complained about, is just a fact of beach life. We stayed 4 nights, then cancelled reservations elsewhere and came back for 3 more. A few guests could be more conscientious about picking up after their dogs (and limiting access to their food bowls!); all, however, were very pleasant, having as much fun as we were, and many said they were repeat customers. We hope to join their ranks.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you love your dog alot.”
Reviews.Author: gruntinaz
Reviews.Content: We planned a weekend and only stayed one night. The wi fi did not work the pool was not heated and it was full of dog waste, homeless,gang members.hippies and lower end yuppies wanting to brag about living by the sea. This place was the worst. don't believe the other stuff written here if you dont have a pet or really really love them then stay away. It was like being in a fallout 3 mod.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for person/couple/family with dogs.”
Reviews.Author: cpa793
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here with our 2 dogs for 4 days and it was a great experience. We travel everywhere with our dogs and this was the most dog friendly hotel we have ever been too. The staff was awsome. The dog beach is right behind the hotel, there is a dog run right out your hotel room patio door, and the community of Ocean Beach is VERY dog friendly. Every restaraunt we went to allowed dogs on the patio with you, brought out water for the dogs, and some even had dog menu's! Usually we stay in La Jolla, or PB when we go to San Diego and we are sneaking our dogs around everywhere, can't bring them on the beach with us etc...It was awsome. Only complaints I have is there are 2 buildings and the dog run behind them is not seperated and your dogs can run out of sight to the next building and then there is the people who don't pick up after their dogs or leave their dogs out in the run ALL DAY so if you just want to let your dog out to do his business and be done its difficult. Let the staff know about a man with 2 aggressive sheppards that was doing this and the staff took care of it within 10 minutes. If your dogs are aggressive DON"T BRING THEM TOO AN OFFLEASH AREA!!! KEEP THEM ON A LEASH!!! USE COMMON SENSE PLEASE, Breakfast, not so good but what do you expect for 100-130 bucks a night on the beach? Apple's, Oranges, Toast, Bagel, and cold cereal. Rooms were big, didn't feel crowded at all with 2 adults and 2 75lb dogs. I will be back again soon...

Reviews.Title: “Beach Bash”
Reviews.Author: gaiatourist
Reviews.Content: The location is the main selling point- right on dog beach- which is the main reason for our stay, we brought the dog. The rooms are basic, pretty clean but I wouldn't call them spotless but when traveling with a dog clean is good enough. The staff are friendly and accommodating- forgot a can opener and the staff cheerfully opened our cans in the office. Walking distance to the main street and restaurants, shops, etc. Prices are a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Staff, Perfect for Dogs”
Reviews.Author: gmar777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location possible if you want to enjoy the beach or have a dog. There is a fee of $25.00 per dog but the location, amenities for dogs and staff make it worth it. You will find no better location as the backyard is literally a leash free dog beach where you can play and swim with your dog. The hotel is not posh and luxurious but it is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny beach in December”
Reviews.Author: dorothygray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July and knew we would return. We chose December since we wanted to get away from the cold weather in Utah. The temperature was in the high 60's low 70's and it was wonderful and sunny. Once again the dogs loved it and my husband was able to go deep sea fishing from a nearby Port.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with your dog!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler from CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Nov. at the Ocean Villa Inn in San Diego. It's a great place to stay with your dog! The lower motel rooms have tile floors, ample space for a large crate and a patio which connects to a common dog run. They also have a dog wash area, laundry facilities, microwave, small refrig. and continental breakfast. The beds were okay, and the room was clean. It's only a short walk to Dog Beach and across the bay from Sea World. (Sea World has 3x7 kennel runs for $5/day-bring your own bowl & kennel mat). On the down side, the room did not have enough lighting (only 2 lamps), the toilet ran and the ceiling fan was quite noisy. Great place for dogs & their owners, but place needs a little maintance/upgrades for the humans. We would stay here again, just because it's well set up for dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for you and your dogs!”
Reviews.Author: Kelligirl
Reviews.Content: We fly with our 2 labs once or twice a month from Phoenix. We have been doing this for 2 years and its a wonderful place to relax and hang. The location and accommodations for you and your dogs- I couldn’t ask for better. (Yes, some of the rooms could be upgraded and you can hear the persons in the rooms above you, but everyone seems to be pretty cool.) We just love hanging with our animals, you don’t sweat the small stuff. There is a great German food restaurant and Wine bar within walking distance. We like to drive to La Jolla for breakfast (Panni) and walk along the coast with the dogs and check out the seals. Its a great experience!!! FYI - Coronado has a good dog beach and Balboa Park is a nice place to walk your dog and they have a dog park too.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, but I just don't get all the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: MollyDink
Reviews.Content: Driving up to this place we were afraid it was going to be a dump, and it was. Checked in anyway (the front desk clerk was very friendly - no complaints there) hoping the room would be a pleasant surprise. It wasn't. The carpet was filthy, the beds were rock hard and the bathroom area had such a musty smell we literally had to hold our breath. Went out to dinner and could hardly bring ourselves to go back into that room for the night. We ended up checking back out (again the desk clerk was friendly but did charge us for the night) and we stayed elsewhere. Maybe the rooms for people with dogs are better - I don't know because we were not travelling with ours, but I cannot in good faith recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Total dump and we're”
Reviews.Author: tulip541
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor even though it was over our budget. We paid with taxes, fees, etc... somewhere around $179/night. I can't figure out why everone raves about this place. It is awful. Thank goodness we only stayed one night. The neighborhood is not great. Pacific Beach is one of the less expensive San Diego beach towns and this area in particular certainly shows it. We are super easy going when it comes to travel but there are limits! My husband, myself and our 2 kids (ages 3 & 5), along with our 2 dogs came in late May, '08. The hotel is dumpy on the outside and the parking lot had 1 space left - lucky for us. Once we got the sticky door open, the room was disgusting. The floor was filthy, the bathroom smelled like urine, the lampshade was falling off, there was a 1x1 wooden stick in the slider (extra security??) and when we went out to the patio, there was dog poop on the lawn, which is shared with other rooms (and their dogs). Walked over to the beach as there were lots of dogs playing - that was fun but the beach is really only for dogs. It's dirty. Continental breakfast is a joke. There is bread, cereal and milk. This motel looks a lot better in pictures than it really is. There are much nicer pet-friendly hotels in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenericmail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Ocean Villa this last weekend to celebrate our 13th Anniversary. Ocean Beach is our home away from home and it was amazing to be out on the balcony looking right at the waves. We could see dog beach, Ocean Beach and the Pier all the way to Mission Beach. It was just Awesome! The room was clean and had everything needed to feel at home. The continental breakfast was a nice treat. While we were there, we saw a lot of families and pet owners. We plan on returning with our kids and our dog in the near future. The staff is very friendly and easy going - just like OB! We definitely recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable place with a great view for a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: tammylynnalex
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from a long weekend stay at Ocean Villa Inn. We did not have dogs with us and although I had read great reviews from people who had dogs, I was concerned about how we would enjoy our stay without them. Well, we were pleasantly surprised. I am rating this above average for the location. The location is really the best. For those with dogs, it's right next to dog beach. For those without, the "people" beach is just across a parking lot from the inn. It's separated from dog beach by a jetty of rocks and you don't even see the dogs unless you walk over a hill and watch them having a great time on their own beach. It was really fun to watch so many different kinds of dogs having such great fun! Also, although there were many dogs staying at the motel, we never heard them at night at all so that was not a problem. The motel is in a residential area and within walking distance to some restaurants and a super quick drive to many others. I would really rate the actual motel as average, but adequate. The outside of the motel is not fancy at all, and the rooms are a little dated, but clean and well maintained. We had a deluxe room with a full fridge, small sink and microwave. It had two queen beds and although one of them was rather noisy, they were comfortable. There was also a couch that made into a bed. One thing though, there was supposed to be HBO and Showtime but we were never able to find them! There is a continental breakfast served, but it is really pretty average at best and we decided to get breakfast elsewhere. Overall, because of the location on the beach, and because it is clean and comfortable, I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation for you and your dog! :)”
Reviews.Author: swainscott
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our dog for our 5 year anniversary and we had the best time! The room was very nice and clean and had tile floors which was great since we had sand all over us after being at the beach. Josh at the front desk was extremely helpful and very friendly. He told us about a restaurant close by that was delicious and allowed dogs on the patio so we went there twice. :) We love the fact that this hotel is on the beach and is so dog friendly. They even have a patio off the room where the dogs can run in a fenced in yard area. This hotel is in a residential section which makes it nice and quiet as well. I know without a doubt that this was our dog's best vacation ever and we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Right by the Ocean!”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoTennisfun
Reviews.Content: Dog Friendly Hotel right by a dog park and the Ocean. We didn't bring our dogs. But the hotel is clean, has free breakfast, and reasonably priced. We walked to the Ocean, lunch, and the peer. It is also about 8 minutes from Seaworld and a wonderful tennis facility. If we go back to San Diego, we will definitely stay at the Ocean Villa Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Lot's of sand”
Reviews.Author: LacieSmiles
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend. A fast drive down and turn around and go back home (East Bay) My issue was the fact that I had 2 dogs. The room was clean, bright and comfortable. It had tile floors since it's a pet friendly room. Located on the first floor. The view was a sand hill. But if you want a ocean view then you need to be on the second floor. An enclosed dog run so they can't wander away. At night we heard/saw fireworks coming from Sea World. That was a surprise. The beach on Sunday was full of dogs and people. Everyone was so friendly. It's also the first time that I have slept in a hotel and woke up without a backache. Very comfortable. My only complaint was the mirror in the bathroom is too far away for me to use with my eye makeup. I need to be really close to it. Maybe add a mirror on the wall that people could pull out?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Travel with your Dog!”
Reviews.Author: TPMMGD
Reviews.Content: I took my family, my wife, daughter who is 12 and our two dogs, Siberian Huskies to this hotel for the weekend. We were planning on going to Sea World and wanted a pet friendly place to stay. We called the property to book over the phone and found this hotel via the web. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. Check in was smooth, no problems, enusre you let them know your are a AAA member! Front office has coffee and tea along with dog treats to welcome your dog! Our room was ok, tile floor, two beds standard. What I liked was the dog run attached to the rooms for potty breaks, even though we kept ours tied up, it was great to meet neighboors and their other friendly dogs and to realize we are not the only family in the world who loves traveling with their dogs! TIP, remember this hotel is booked up espically in the rooms just for dogs so we did not expect a 5 diamond resort. If you take the "white glove" treatment and put on your glasses and inspect of course you will find some areas that need improvements and the same can be said for the home you live in. I liked the newer microwave and refrigerator in our room. We really enjoyed the heated pool and the ability to have our dogs sit around the pool, dogs not allowed in the pool of course. We enjoyed the comp cont. breakfast and the location of this property is perfect for any person with a dog who likes to relax on vacation with their dog. The dog beach is only a two minute walk from the hotel, beach is clean and very spread out, plenty of room for your dogs to run. Their is even a off leash dog park within a 5 minute drive from the hotel which we went to often. Also we used the Sea World Pet Facility and placed out two dogs in for only $5.00/day! Make sure you bring a water bowl as water is provided but not a bowl! Overall if you are looking for a GREAT experience to visit Sea World and do any beach activities this is the place to stay! The hotel is amid a residentail district with plenty of opportunities for great food as well! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dog Beach Lovers read on!”
Reviews.Author: Fleethescene
Reviews.Content: If you love to travel with your dogs and love the beach, Ocean Villa Inn is the place for you. Catering to canines is an understatement. The rooms open to a fenced in dog run that allows your pets to explore at their leisure and make friends with fellow dogs and dog lovin travelers. A short walk to Ocean Beach Dog Beach is a reason to stay on it's own. Not to mention the numerous shops and dinning establishments all within walking distance and 99% pet friendly. A perfect place for me and my dogs! Susan. Las Vegas, NV.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ocean Villa Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: Azgals
Reviews.Content: Ocean Villa Inn in San Diego is the best place for dog lovers to stay with their dogs! The rooms have lots of extra floor space, it's practically steps from the beach, and is extremely clean. They go the extra mile to make sure pets and people are taken care of. From dog towels and a dog wash station to people breakfast (more than just continental) and a pool, it's wonderful. Thanks to Whitney and all the staff at Ocean Beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, so close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: nomadina
Reviews.Content: It was clean and comfy, with a really warm night staff. The room was comfortable and was a nice size. It had few other pieces of furniture and ample storage space for our bags. It had a pool that was heated, snacks for late nights and everyone got to see the fireworks at seaworld. We had a very nice intimate time with fresh air and coziness.

Reviews.Title: “doggie heaven”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDogs
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at Ocean Beach Villa Inn. I own two large dogs who travel everywhere with me. The people at the hotel are very accomodating and love dogs. The motel is located right on the ocean next to the best leash free dog beach is southern Ca. There is a wonderful walking path along the bay with amazing bird watching also. There are numerous fabulous dining establishments within walking distance of the motel and the staff always point you in just the right direction depending on your wants and needs. Downtown OB is also within an easy walk. I especially loved the fact I didn't need to drive anywhere in the city unless I chose to check out all the other wonderful attractions available in San Diego. Ocean Beach is an easy drive to almost anywhere you'd like to explore in San Diego. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The laundry room is an added plus when staying longer than a few days and traveling with pets. The continental breakfast is more than adequate and replenished until closed, The rooms are clean and large and are supplied with both micro and fridge. On my last stay there were a few repairs that needed to be done. The management was quick to take care of these. Oh and did I mention they have an incredible succulant/catus garden surrounding the property. I can't wait to return this month when the prices go down!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway with your dogs”
Reviews.Author: AzAmy
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in ocean beach and at Ocean Villa inn. The staff are very friendly, and the facility is totally pet friendly. The pet rooms are on the bottom floor and open up to a fenced in community area for the dogs to run. The hotel is a five minute walk from the dog beach, and the regular beach. Great restaurants and bars within walking distance. We didn't get in our car the whole weekend. Laid back beach, everyone was so friendly. Can't wait for our next visit -neither can our dogs!

Reviews.Title: “Life's a Beach”
Reviews.Author: joezilch
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, recently remodeled. Not elegant but not meant to be. It's a fun, relaxed place to get away, either with or without your pets. Yes, it's pet friendly. There is a fenced-in, grassy dog run the length of the property. This Inn is right off Dog Beach which is part of Ocean Beach, San Diego. 'Downtown" Ocean beach is minutes away by bike, which is the preferable way to get there due to limited parking. There is ample parking at the Inn. There is a Continental breakfast available each morning, as well as a microwave and refrigerator in each room. It's easily accessed from the freeway and there are many good restaurants within a short drive. The office staff is available, friendly, helpful anb accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “The Best for Pets!”
Reviews.Author: kwebb2005
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place if traveling with pets. It is right on dog beach in Ocean Beach and the staff is terrific. There are many great restraunts within walking distance (especially O Bistro and SouthBeach) and just a great all around place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday getaway with your dog!”
Reviews.Author: ksateri
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic motel type of property where you can stay with your dog, where most private patios lead to a clean dog run, and is steps from the beach and an outdoor park like area. The beach is off leash for dogs, and you feel like you are in a small local town in this area of San Diego. Walk to the local restaurants and dog friendly shops, and enjoy the friendly staff at the Ocean Villa Inn. Free Continental breakfast is included, the rooms are clean, reasonable rates....I love this place and have been there twice in one year. Nothing fancy here, but down to earth and so relaxing...

Reviews.Title: “Freakin Dive!!”
Reviews.Author: bigdick1
Reviews.Content: This place is a freaking dive.It's not worth more than $49.00 bucks a nite.This place caters to dog lovers so expect fleas!! I paid over $200.00 a nite through Orbitz,they're both a bunch of crooks!! Please do not ever book this dive, you'll be sorry!!And I couldn't get a refund beacuse I booked it the same day and they say I needed 48hrs before to cancel( how is that possible?)Either way if your ok with a motel 4 then book it, if not keep lookin!!

Reviews.Title: “great for animal lovers”
Reviews.Author: muleblack
Reviews.Content: Dogs had a great time here with a large fenced area to check out their 4 legged neighbors, so son also had a fun time. With dog beach right next door, it's about a perfect place for a beach time with dogs and kids. Decent breakfast arrangements also.

Reviews.Title: “Went for one night...stayed two.”
Reviews.Author: alvinincal
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has been a returning guest for some years now and kept telling me to visit this place. Recently, a turn of events somewhat forced me to take a "break". I decided on Ocean Villa as a get away with the pooch. It was an excellent call. I debated between this and the OB Hotel (by the pier), but this one is a little out the the downtown area, but only about .5 mile. From the moment I made the call, I knew I had made the right choice. The staff makes you feel like you are staying with friends and go out of their way to let you know everything that is available, which is quite a bit. They have a nice, better than average continental breakfast every morning, coffee all day long in the lobby, towels for the pets, pet bath area, laundry room, beach towels for the pool, and tranquility. The room was spacious and comfortable. It is obvious that it has been "around" for a while, but it was clean, less the carpet which left my feet dirty (needs shampooing). Other than that and the bathroom sink needing a bottle of Drano, it was perfect. The back yard is Dog Beach which is awesome. Having a fridge and microwave saves from having to eat all meals outside and allows one to bring leftovers back. The location is great for a get-away. Close enough to the main street, but not too close. Nice local restaurants, coffee places, etc. just blocks away. I just had to stay another night. Will plan better next time which I expect will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “MY FAVORITE DOG BEACH GET-AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: nocats4me
Reviews.Content: I am a return guest to Ocean Villa Inn because the rooms are terrific, very people and dog friendly. So close to the ocean and many San Diego attractions. I love the friendly atmosphere of all the other dog guests as well. Have never had a bad stay and love to tell my friends about this little jewel on the beach! K. Singer Phx, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: outtosea64
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, great location and clean, comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Spot Ever!”
Reviews.Author: pedrogal
Reviews.Content: This gem is truly the best place and best deal in town. We had never traveled with our dog before and this was quite the enjoyable experience. The staff was so welcoming and wonderful. The rooms are great and so clean. We took a Family Suite downstairs patio room - which I highly recommend. You get a larger living area and the kitchenette was great. Full size fridge with microwave and sink and table area. The location right on the beach can't be beat. We made friends with the folks in the rooms around us and the dogs came and went and had a blast. We laughed so much and spent time getting to know great people. We can't wait to go back again. Valdez Family

Reviews.Title: “myrtle goes to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: bookwormpro
Reviews.Content: my friends @ the dog park in mesa, az told me about this place, so we went @ the beginning of june for several days - yay!! it's @ dog beach, so of course myrtle was thrilled!! so many dogs,so little time....& waves, sand, glorious sun, did i mention the waves?...the rooms are fine,with a little patio - remember you came here for the beach & not to stay inside! - & have fridges,microwave,coffeepot, and are very very dog-friendly - the 'furries' visit each other in the rooms if you leave the sliding doors open & the enclosed area all along the back is great - even a dog shower area @ the far end - 'furries' really enjoy this vacation! - your neighbors will be fur-baby parents too, so you'll all get along & enjoy your stay i found the staff quite friendly and helpful, & wasn't bothered by the 7-9am breakfast bar since i wake early - it's great that soy milk is offered!!! - [& you can always grab something, go back to sleep & use that microwave sitting on the counter for you :-) ] we're going back this month for a couple days on the beach! UPDATE myrtle's packing her bags, we're going to stay here on our way home to az from seal beach, ca !

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_L1
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Ocean Villa Inn for many years when we take our dogs to San Diego. The staff couldnt be more accommodating and the location is very convenient right there on the leash free dog beach. They also have a nice breakfast and are within walking distance to local restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great little inn steps from the beach!”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjulz
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Villa Inn is literally steps away from the beach in Ocean Beach, and we took advantage of that. The first night we got there it was around 10:30 or 11pm, and after driving the scenic route down highway 101 it had been a long day. We decided to take our boys (ages 11 and 20 months) down to the beach to let them (and my husband and I) blow off some steam. What we found were about 10-15 different bonfires on the beach with about 10-20 people surrounding each one. It was very cool, and everyone was very respectful. We went back to our second floor room, and went right to sleep! The inn accepts travelers with pets, so those people get the first floor (tile on the floor in those rooms). Since we did not bring our pugs this trip we were put on the second floor. The room was just what we needed: a mini kitchen with a fridge and microwave; 2 queen size beds; a full size futon; a separate room with sink; shower/tub, toilet; and closet; and best of all a great private balcony with a view of the beach and ocean! The inn itself has kind of a sixties Rat Pack feel, but it is not dumpy by any means. It has a nice pool, beautiful cactus garden, and palm trees galore. The staff was friendly and appeared to be surfers who worked there to support their surfing habit. The continental breakfast is decent but not indulgent--but the best part is that is included in the price of the room. The location is great for families, travelers with pets, or couples with its close access to the people beach, dog beach, skate park, Sea World, and all of the sites that San Diego has to offer. I will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “We all (human and canine) loved the Ocean Villa Inn.”
Reviews.Author: ChachoClancy
Reviews.Content: Our two cocker spaniels, Chacho and Clancy and my husband and I stayed at the Ocean Villa Inn for two nights starting on Memorial Day. We were so happy with the accomodations. The room opened to a huge enclosed patio/run where all the dogs could come and go safely. The room was clean and comfortable. The location next to the Dog Beach was perfect! The staff at the OVI was so friendly and helpful. We will definitely go back in a couple of months and plan to make this a twice a year vacation destination for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pet Friendly Motel”
Reviews.Author: andyroseScottsdale
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay with your pet. Close to the beach. The staff is friendly. The rooms clean. The dog play area is clean. The breakfast was great. Just had a wonderful time. I am going back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location....right next to the dog beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Toni26
Reviews.Content: We love Ocean Villa Inn! This was our second stay here and we will definitely return with our two dogs. It is so convenient to the dog beach, restaurants, and shopping that we actually parked our car for the whole stay and walked everywhere! The staff is very people and dog-friendly! If you're planning a fun time with your pooch at the beach, and need a great place to stay, Ocean Villa Inn would be it! My husband and I and our two dogs, Dixie and Harley, highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: dietcolanut
Reviews.Content: I originally booked at this hotel just because they had a room in the area I needed and it was affordable, I did not even bring my dog on this trip. I was also a bit skeptical about how they could make the "dog" accommodations work and have clean rooms. I tell you, they do it! I will book again because it is a cute hotel, with nice rooms, friendly staff, and a fun environment. Walking distance with your “free” morning all you can drink coffee to the beach, or sit out on your own patio; all this and they allow you to bring along Fido too! I’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: happystay12365
Reviews.Content: My Family and I have really enjoyed staying here. We love dog beach and love bringing our dogs with us. There are great restaurants in the area that also allow dogs and we love the laid back atmosphere. What a great place to stay!!! We also like the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great rate.”
Reviews.Author: Johnklop
Reviews.Content: Just steps from Dog Beach, Ocean Beach's famous "dog friendly" park. Though the Villa advertises itself as being dog friendly, and many people brought dogs, we didn't and weren't bothered at all by dogs. Our second floor room was very spacious, large balcony overlooking the Mission Bay Channel of the San Diego River, and the ocean. It was a non smoking non pet room. We had a microwave and a fridge in the room. There is always coffee, fresh fruit and microwave popcorn in the lobby. The staff was really great. Kelly and Whitney have picked their favorite places, including the all day happy hour $2.50 well drinks at an odd place called Pacific Shores, about four blocks away. Be sure to walk 3/4 of the way out to the resturaunt on the Ocean Beach concrete pier for great lobster tacos, and among the best fries we've ever had. The pool is very nice. There was a feeling of laid back comfort about the whole place. Each morning there's a continental breakfast of fresh fruit, muffins, hard boiled eggs and cereal. We found them on the web, studied their website, and called to make the reservation. The only drawback is that it's under the flight path, so sometimes the planes are pretty loud, but the San Diego airport is right in the middle of town, so you hear them most places. Extremely good value, great location and a very nice stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Dog-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: marytrary5
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this trip, since it was our first time traveling with our dogs and staying in a hotel/motel instead of a house or cabin, but Ocean Villa Inn made our stay fun. Everyone was very relaxed, the front desk was very helpful and everything was perfect for pups: tile floor throughout the room, easy access to the fenced backyard and clean-up area on the side to rinse off after playing at the very nearby Dog Beach. The heated pool was nice, since it was fairly cool during our trip and the ocean was definitely not warm enough for our liking. Their policy of checking in with the desk before we left our dogs in the room alone was completely reasonable and actually reassuring to know if there was a problem someone would call us. I would highly recommend this hotel to people with four-legged children who are well-socialized. I truly have never seen so many people with dogs as we did in Ocean Beach: the whole community is for dog-lovers! My only complaint was that the furniture was over-sized for the room, making it a bit crowded especially after setting up the dog crate, but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “4th Annual all about Buddy vacation”
Reviews.Author: buddyboy72
Reviews.Content: May of 2008 was the 4th annual all about Buddy vacation for my parents, me & my child (dog) Buddy. Every time we visit, our stay is that much better than the last time. We were ALL having such a great time that we decided to stay another night. I want to thank ALL of the staff for their hospitality! See you next year for the 5th annual all about Buddy vacation. Take care, Joy Ross & Buddy Ross Paradise Valley, AZ

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: francar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for our weekend away with our pooch. It's good value for money, the location couldn't be better (right on the beach) and as there's a secure wrap around garden that meant that when we were in our room, doggie could wander in and out as he pleased, not cooped up like in other hotels. The staff are helpful and friendly and the general ambiance of the Ocean Beach area is very 'Chilled'. Perfect for de-stressing!

Reviews.Title: “Doggie Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Winterman101
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for families with dogs, we go there frequently and always have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, Dog-Friendly Ocean Beach”
Reviews.Author: Kittyhorsehawk
Reviews.Content: This is a cute, sweet, simple, and VERY dog friendly hotel in the Ocean Beach neighborhood of San Diego. They allow up to 4 dogs with various reasonable fees, you can leave your dog in your room with restrictions, and there is a leash free common yard behind the rooms! As if that wasn't enough, Ocean Villa is about 1/4 of a block from the GIANT, off leash dog beach and a river running trail. "Downtown" Ocean Beach, which is full of friendly people and dogs is within walking distance. Ocean Beach is a unique and mellow surf community, and there is a TON of stuff in walking, biking and driving distance -- this place is AMAZING for people traveling with or without dogs!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Villa Review”
Reviews.Author: CraigCarmelIN
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Villa is located in a quiet neighborhood in Ocean Beach, California. There is a beach for families and dogs outside our room. The hotel was probably built in the 60s; but has been renovated and is very comfortable/family friendly.. It has friendly staff and is clean! The room has great storage space for personal belongings. It also has a refrigerator and microwave to use; which comes in very handy. All rooms have a patio which overlooks the ocean. A very nice continental breakfast is included in the modest charge. It is within walking distance of a very nice shopping area/restaurants. It is quaint and offers a great opportunity for families with pets to stay right on thebeach. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great little motel”
Reviews.Author: RichardF_PG
Reviews.Content: We found it to be a great little motel. The location was great with the beach right behind the motel; a quiet spot to return to after a day of sight-seeing. We liked to sit on the balcony overlooking the beach to eat our complimentary breakfast, which was nothing fancy, but good, nonetheless. My wife liked the cactus and succulents,all labeled, planted around the parking lot, many of which were in bloom while we were there. The Ocean Villa is "dog friendly" but we saw only a couple of dogs and didn't hear any. The only downside, and I really would rather not include this, in case it turns potential guests away, but the motel is very near the the flight path for the San Diego Airport. We heard lots of planes, BUT, NO planes fly after 10pm or before 6:30am. We really appreciated the Ocean Villa as a great place for our family and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “added charges to credit card 4 days after leaving”
Reviews.Author: cathartes
Reviews.Content: Not open and upfront about what the room will cost - beware of making reservations online! I reserved a room here online and when I arrived I was told the room would cost I expected from the reservation. My next statement showed this charge and then an additional charge of 15.00 four days later. When I called to ask what the extra charge was, she explained that there was an additional pet fee that I hadn't been charged for originally and that I'd signed something that said I agreed to the pet fee. It is almost as if someone behind the counter forgot to charge me and said it would cost so much and the accountant decided that I hadn't been charged enough. READ THE FINE PRINT AND BEWARE THAT YOU MIGHT BE SIGNING SOMETHING THAT YOU AGREE TO BE CHARGED MORE THAN YOU AUTHORIZE!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: marla5575
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is the very first property off the beach, which is the reason I chose it for a trip with my dogs. OB is a great little town, everywhere I went I was reminded of Venice Beach here in LA. Lots of friendly people, awesome co-op for groceries, and dogs are welcome almost everywhere. However, location is the only thing it has going for it...it's pretty run down and in need of some major upgrades - really overpriced for the quality of the rooms. We were woken every morning by the stomping of the upstairs guests getting ready for their day - it appears the insulation is really bad between upstairs floor and downstairs ceiling, and dogs are not allowed in upstairs rooms (I always prefer top floor because of noise issues), which of course are the rooms with the water & sunset views. The bottom of the bathroom door was water damaged, the entryway light didn't work and the bathroom lights flicker on (sort of Bates Motel-ish). But like I said, this place has location and the staff is super friendly. Because of that, I will definitely return. I strongly recommend bringing slippers - the floors are tile. As a side note, if you don't care about being close to the the dog beach, I also really like the Best Western Lamplighter on El Cajon - location isn't great but the staff is awesome and the price is a little lower. See my review.

Reviews.Title: “Life at the beach”
Reviews.Author: karentucson
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Ocean Villa Inn for 10 year now. It is fabulous...close to the water and 15 minutes or so from almost everything else. It is a small Inn and therfore quiet. Parking is close and ample. We stayed in room 31 which is our favorite. Unfortunately on this trip the heater was not working, the toilet backed up and one of the box springs squeaked every time you moved. The staff was very helpful in providing us with extra blankets and a plunger. Maintenance came the next day and flipped the mattress which helped a little, but not much. He was not able to fix the heater so we were provided with a portable radiator which took care of the chilly night temperatures. One trial with the plunger and that was taken care of as well. We had a very loud party going on next door on New Years Eve. Once again the staff was attentive and dealt with the situation quickly and appropriately. It took sveral contacts from the staff but the excessive noise finally did stop. We stay at the Ocean Villa Inn because it is normally very quiet and located close to the water. We have also been pleased with the staff handling issues should they arise. We have enjoyed 10 years of vacationing at Ocean Beach and hope to enjoy staying at Ocean VIlla Inn for at least another 10. Despite the issues we had a very restful and relaxing stay. We will be returning the first weekend in April and hope that the box spring on the bed by the balcony has been replaced and the heater has been fixed by then. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “My new Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: spaceystaceylawler
Reviews.Content: With its beutiful ocean views, and pet friendly atmosphere, ocean villa inn is the perfect place for dog lovers of all kinds. It is a quick 2 min walk to dog beach where you can have your dogs off leash to play with other dogs in and around the beutiful ocean. It has a continental breakfast, and the staff was very friendly. Behind the pet friendly rooms is a fenced in grass area for you to take your pets out to take care of thier business and the neccesary tools needed to clean up after them too. I would recomend this hotel to anyone who loves dogs. Ocean Villa Inn is walking distance to many restraunts and some of them will actually allow you to bring your dog with you, and alow you to eat on the patio. I only have one suggestion for improvement on this hotel. I would love to see another ramp on the side of the hotel closest to the beach, as to make it easier for disabled persons to get to thier rooms. Thank you

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Villa Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5142 West Point Loma Blvd., San Diego, CA 92017
